title: Android Weekly Issue #628
description: Articles & Tutorials Sponsored Want mobile observability built on open source? You need the right data to improve app performance and user experiences. With Embrace, get user-focused mobile telemetry, crucial performance insights, and better collaboration with your backend team. Built with open source, OpenTelemetry SDKs for full transparency, portability, and extensibility. Jetpack Glance Stefano Natali examines the Compose way to build beautiful Widgets on Android. What Are Dynamic App Shortcuts? Sandeep Kella takes a look at Dynamic App Shortcuts, which let you add shortcuts to your app that can change while the app is running. Sponsored Add paywalls in one line of code Take the pain out of configuring and testing your app's paywalls. With RevenueCat Paywalls you can remotely configure and edit your entire paywall view without waiting on App Review. What is faster and in which tasks? Coroutines, RxJava, Executor? Have you ever wondered which multithreading framework is the fastest? Danil Perevalov shares the results of several tests. Seamless Screenshot Testing for Compose with Screenshotbot Joe Birch explores Screenshotbot, which can help alleviate some of the friction experienced when trying to integrate screenshot tests into your workflow. Using Lists in Compose Previews Donovan LaDuke examines a built-in implementation for Compose previews that doesn't require calling asSequence on a List. The Starter kit for Android Platform Engineering Sid Patil takes you from the initial machine setup for building AOSP, and IDE configurations, to booting your very first Android system image on a compatible device. Gradle Properties Understanding how Gradle properties work can save you a lot of time debugging. Tadeas Kriz explains how to set properties and what their priorities are. Boosting App Performance with Baseline Profile Sagar Khuranaenhanced writes about enhancing app startup time by over 20% and runtime performance by more than 25% through the integration of Baseline Profile. Place a sponsored post Advertise your Android dev course to over 80k readers We reach out to more than 80k Android developers around the world, every week, through our email newsletter and social media channels. Advertise your Android development course! Libraries & Code iCore iCore is a comprehensive Android library designed to streamline the development process by providing a robust set of modular components. It provides parameters to customize the behavior of overscroll effects. composetheme Compose Theme provides you with the API to build your design system. It gives you a flexible way to define your own design tokens and properties which are easily accessible from your composables. News The Third Beta of Android 15 Android 15 Beta 3 release takes Android 15 to Platform Stability, which means that the developer APIs and all app-facing behaviors are now final for you to review and integrate into your apps, Android Device Streaming, powered by Firebase, is now in Beta Google created Android Device Streaming, powered by Firebase, for running tests on a wide variety of devices. Enabling safe AI experiences on Google Play Google Play has some updates to policies regarding apps making use of generative AI. Videos & Podcasts 3 must-know updates from Google Play at I/O '24 This 90 seconds recap covers the 3 must-know updates from Google Play Building Your First Compose Multiplatform Hello World App Philipp Lackner teaches how to build your first Compose Multiplatform Hello World App! AI development assistance In this episode, hear from Kathy Korevec from the AIDA team at Google about AI assisted developer tools, such as Android Studio -- which is using Gemini AI models provided by AIDA. How to Make a Clean Architecture App using MVVM & Jetpack Compose Daniel Atitienei shows how to make a clean architecture anime list app using MVVM & Jetpack Compose in this tutorial. Mastering WebRTC for Large Conference Calls on Android with Ivan Shafran Learn about WebRTC, a common tool for making internet calls. Observing an Internet Connection in a KMP App Learn about observing an Internet Connection in a KMP App Top 3 Search Techniques Most Devs Miss! Charfaoui Younes shares three different strategies for efficiently searching for solutions online. KotlinConf 2024 All the presentations from KotlinConf 2024

You need the right data to improve app performance and user experiences. With Embrace, get user-focused mobile telemetry, crucial performance insights, and better collaboration with your backend team. Built with open source, OpenTelemetry SDKs for full transparency, portability, and extensibility.

Stefano Natali examines the Compose way to build beautiful Widgets on Android.

Sandeep Kella takes a look at Dynamic App Shortcuts, which let you add shortcuts to your app that can change while the app is running.

Take the pain out of configuring and testing your app's paywalls. With RevenueCat Paywalls you can remotely configure and edit your entire paywall view without waiting on App Review.

Understanding how Gradle properties work can save you a lot of time debugging. Tadeas Kriz explains how to set properties and what their priorities are.

iCore is a comprehensive Android library designed to streamline the development process by providing a robust set of modular components.

A library to help auto-generate screenshot tests from Composable Previews with any screenshot testing library: JVM-based (i.e. Paparazzi, Roborazzi) as well as Instrumentation-based (i.e. Shot, Dropshots, Android-Testify, etc.)

Squishy is a lightweight library for controlling the overscroll effect of parent containers or child composables based on user input. It provides parameters to customize the behavior of overscroll effects.

Compose Theme provides you with the API to build your design system. It gives you a flexible way to define your own design tokens and properties which are easily accessible from your composables.

Android 15 Beta 3 release takes Android 15 to Platform Stability, which means that the developer APIs and all app-facing behaviors are now final for you to review and integrate into your apps,

In this episode, hear from Kathy Korevec from the AIDA team at Google about AI assisted developer tools, such as Android Studio -- which is using Gemini AI models provided by AIDA.
